title: Japan's Rugby World Cup clash with Scotland finally gets underway in Yokohama
text:
The Rugby World Cup clash between Japan and Scotland in Yokohama went ahead on Sunday, despite the fixture having been placed in doubt due to Typhoon Hagibis.

A decision to allow the game to be played with fans in attendance was made on Sunday morning.

Scotland had threatened legal action if the game had been cancelled.

Scotland's Rugby World Cup clash against Japan went ahead despite weather concerns

At least 23 people have been killed by Typhoon Hagibis, with a minute's silence having been held before the game.

Weather conditions in Yokohama improved significantly on Sunday morning.

Before the game both teams observed a minute's silence for the victims of Typhoon Hagibis

Early on Sunday morning workers were at the stadium in order to ensure that the game could go ahead.

Sunday's match between Namibia and Canada in Kamaishi was called off.
